alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 7:28PM MST until December 14 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...STORM WINDING DOWN ACROSS THE REGION... .A strong winter storm system will continue to track into central Nebraska tonight with decreasing snowfall across the northeast plains. With snowfall decreasing and visibilities improving,the blizzard warning will be cancelled and replaced with a winter weather advisory, mainly for strong winds through Wednesday. Considering the amount of fallen snow, there will be considerable blowing and drifting snow over the northeast plains tonight and during the daytime on Wednesday. Keep in mind many roadways are still closed this evening across northeast Colorado. People planning travel north or east of Denver through Wednesday, or those with outdoor livestock interests should prepare for continued cold and windy weather behind the storm Wednesday and Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST WEDNESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Limon. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
